| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line3197](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line3197 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

A **water hulk**, U is a type of [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). It is an aquatic counterpart to the [umber hulk](/wiki/Umber_hulk "Umber hulk") that can [swim](/wiki/Swim "Swim"), and possesses the same melee attacks and [confusing](/wiki/Confusion "Confusion") [gaze](/wiki/Gaze "Gaze").

## Generation

Water hulks are only randomly generated in [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom"), and may generate as peaceful towards [neutral](/wiki/Neutral "Neutral") characters.

In SlashTHEM and Hack'EM, water hulks can generate in the [terror hall](/index.php?title=Terror_hall\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Terror hall (page does not exist)") [special room](/index.php?title=Special_room_\(SlashTHEM\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Special room (SlashTHEM) (page does not exist)").

## Strategy

Save for their ability to swim in deep waters, water hulks are no different from umber hulks in practice, and much of the same strategy that applies to umber hulks also applies to them.

## Encyclopedia entry

Umber hulks are powerful subterranean predators whose  
iron-like claws allow them to burrow through solid stone in  
search of prey. They are tremendously strong; muscles bulge  
beneath their thick, scaly hides and their powerful arms and  
legs all end in great claws.

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Water_hulk\&action=edit)*

Water hulk

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
U water hulk
Difficulty 14
Attacks Claw 3d4, Claw 3d4, Bite 2d5, Gaze confusion
U water hulk
Difficulty 14
Attacks

Claw 3d4, Claw 3d4, Bite 2d5, Gaze confusion

Base level 11
Base experience 246
Speed 6
Base AC 2
Base MR 25
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1200
Nutritional value 500
Size Large
Resistances None
Resistances conveyed None

A water hulk:

  • can swim.
  • can tunnel through walls.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is strong.
  • appears only in Gehennom.
  • hits creatures as a +1 weapon.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line3197

A water hulk, U is a type of monster that appears in SLASH'EM, SlashTHEM and Hack'EM. It is an aquatic counterpart to the umber hulk that can swim, and possesses the same melee attacks and confusing gaze.

Generation

Water hulks are only randomly generated in Gehennom, and may generate as peaceful towards neutral characters.

In SlashTHEM and Hack'EM, water hulks can generate in the terror hall special room.

Strategy

Save for their ability to swim in deep waters, water hulks are no different from umber hulks in practice, and much of the same strategy that applies to umber hulks also applies to them.

Encyclopedia entry

Umber hulks are powerful subterranean predators whose
iron-like claws allow them to burrow through solid stone in
search of prey. They are tremendously strong; muscles bulge
beneath their thick, scaly hides and their powerful arms and
legs all end in great claws.

This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

A '''water hulk''', {{monsym|water hulk}} is a type of [[monster]] that appears in [[SLASH'EM]], [[SlashTHEM]] and [[Hack'EM]]. It is an aquatic counterpart to the [[umber hulk]] that can [[swim]], and possesses the same melee attacks and [[Confusion|confusing]] [[gaze]].

==Generation==
Water hulks are only randomly generated in [[Gehennom]], and may generate as peaceful towards [[neutral]] characters.

In SlashTHEM and Hack'EM, water hulks can generate in the [[terror hall]] [[Special room (SlashTHEM)|special room]].

==Strategy==
Save for their ability to swim in deep waters, water hulks are no different from umber hulks in practice, and much of the same strategy that applies to umber hulks also applies to them.

==Encyclopedia entry==

Umber hulks are powerful subterranean predators whose
iron-like claws allow them to burrow through solid stone in
search of prey.  They are tremendously strong; muscles bulge
beneath their thick, scaly hides and their powerful arms and
legs all end in great claws.
}}
